weekly_overview:
This week's congressional trading activity was dominated by two Republican members with significantly large portfolio movements. Jefferson Shreve (R-IN) led with 42 trades valued between $20.9 million and $52.5 million, while Dave McCormick (R-PA) completed 2 trades worth $1.25 million to $5.5 million. Other notable activity included Josh Gottheimer (D-NJ) with 49 trades in the $63,000-$770,000 range and French Hill (R-AR) with 4 trades valued at $180,000-$450,000.

The trading occurred amid broader discussions about institutional investment in residential real estate markets, with news reports focusing on potential policy changes regarding large investors purchasing homes. The congressional financial disclosures show continued active trading across party lines, with both Republican and Democratic members engaging in various market transactions ranging from smaller positions under $100,000 to multi-million dollar portfolio adjustments.
top_movers:
• **Jefferson Shreve shows the highest trading volume** with 42 total transactions (15 purchases, 27 sales) and a total value range of $20.9 million to $52.6 million, significantly exceeding all other representatives.

• **Josh Gottheimer demonstrates the most active trading frequency** with 49 total transactions (12 purchases, 37 sales), though his total value range of $63,049 to $770,000 is relatively modest compared to his transaction volume.

• **Dave McCormick has the second-highest value range** of $1.25 million to $5.5 million despite conducting only 2 total transactions, indicating high-value individual trades.
industry_highlights: Congressional trading data reveals a strong preference for traditional financial sector investments, with banking trades outnumbering cryptocurrency trades by more than 6 to 1 (82 versus 13 trades). This pattern suggests lawmakers are focusing their investment activity primarily on established financial institutions rather than emerging digital asset markets.
